alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 9:24AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs along the banks of Salmon Falls Creek. Water from Salmon Falls Creek begins entering the Salmon Falls Creek rest area along U.S. 93, about 3 miles south of Jackpot, NV. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 9.7 feet late Tuesday evening. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
